I would not loose the Opportunity of writing to you—tho I must be short.
I have not been used to such Ways.
We dine at four O Clock.
We are crowded with a Levee in the Evening.
Fifty Gentlemen meeting together, all Strangers, are not acquainted with Each others Language, Ideas, Views, Designs.
They are therefore jealous, of each other—fearfull, timid, skittish,—
